conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid from A encounters a horizontal baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from A flows rightward until it reaches the vertical baffle.
Vertical baffle directs liquid from A downward into container D.
Liquid from B encounters a horizontal baffle directing it to the left.
Liquid from B flows leftward until it reaches the vertical baffle.
Vertical baffle directs liquid from B downward into container E.
Liquid from C encounters a horizontal baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from C flows rightward until it reaches the vertical baffle.
Vertical baffle directs liquid from C downward into container D.
Liquid from A and C will flow into container D, and liquid from B will flow into container E.
Liquid will flow into both containers D and E, with D receiving liquid from A and C, and E receiving liquid from B.
